@xingzt the "Mysql/JDBI/PreparedStatement…" represents that your service connects to MySQL, the fact that it's red represents that there's error when executing SQL, you can click it to show the detail, such as error message and the SQL it tries to execute

> @stone-wlg please fix CI and submodule confilct.

Hi, i am doing CI, but about skywalking-ui conflicts i could not see the detail. skywalking-ui is a submodule, should i clone it independently and make commits ? or just follow the skywalking https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/v6.3.0/docs/en/guides/How-to-build.md, then make commits on it, but i did it and no conflicts when i merge features/cassandra-3.x-plugin to master on  my fork skywalking.
@stone-wlg skywalking-ui is a git submodule, you need make sure it makes commitid. Compile and git conflict are two different things.

I wouldn't recommend you use two APM agents together. I have no experience in this case. Deadlock is occasionally caused by startup sequence, which is hard to tell.

From your log, it looks like gRPC conflicts.
It shows ElasticSearch 503, so you need to find out what is the error of your ElasticSearch

@webb2019 we use [checkstyle maven plugin](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io) to check the code style and the license header, the config file locates at `apm-checkstyle/checkStyle.xml`, which can be imported into IntelliJ IDEA if you have [checkstyle-idea](https://github.com/jshiell/checkstyle-idea) installed
If you used to connect successfully, check you ElasticSearch whether the config(yml) is changed? I am not sure.

I have added the doc 
and compile all the project locally to test for finding the reason for CI.
Local compilation has passed and I am also confused why CI always fails and no specific failure reason? Is there any method to find out what caused CI failure?
What's more, I also care about if this update works well for all scenerios. Welcome to hear more test response about using log4j2 AsyncRoot

> @stone-wlg skywalking-ui is a git submodule, you need make sure it makes commitid. Compile and git conflict are two different things.

Hi @wu-sheng , i am confusing that how to submit skywalking-ui changes, because i have no rights to submit the changes on skywalking-rocketbot-ui project, so could i make a fork on skywalking-rocketbot-ui project, and commit changes on my forked skywalking-rocketbot-ui, then ask pull request from my forked skywalking-rocketbot-ui to official skywalking-rocketbot-ui first ?  or is there any instruction that i can follow ?

You don't need any change to ui module, from my understanding. If you do, that change should be done by another PR to there directly.

Current error is, you are changing submodule, which is unexpected. You just need to make sure your submodule commit id equals master branch.
CI looks good for now. @zhaoyuguang @dmsolr @kezhenxu94 @JaredTan95 Any of you are using this log?
First of all, H2 is not for long time running, it is for demo only. Also, in default, H2 is running in momery mode. If you are expecting it is running in a more stable way, change H2 to server mode.

> You don't need any change to ui module, from my understanding. If you do, that change should be done by another PR to there directly.
> 
> Current error is, you are changing submodule, which is unexpected. You just need to make sure your submodule commit id equals master branch.

ok, i do not need to change UI project even i add new plugin, but there will be some elements missing on UI, is there somebody to fix it?
With OOM or some mechanism/bug inside H2, this may happen. I am not sure. But this is not the usual case.
@wurenny That is docker or k8s story :) Not SkyWalking's. My own use case is staying in UTC-0, so, I don't know what happens.
@tsuilouis if it uses JDK 8, please move it into `optional-plugins` module

At SkyWalking, the JDK requirement is your plugin codes, rather than your target lib code level. All plugins activated by default should be able to be loaded(not running) in JVM 1.6.

If you want it to be the default, change the plugin codes, and don't use JDK 1.6+ classes. Otherwise, it should stay in optional, and add document about it, as we have several plugins there already.
I have a quick glance at the code, and it seems that it didn't use JDK6+ features, so it should be safe to stay in `apm-sdk-plugin`, I'll have a detailed look later, thanks @tsuilouis

@evanxuhe  I tested it, the result is not what we expected, 
This is my demo：
pom.xml
```
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-log4j2</artifactId>
    <version>2.1.2.RELEASE</version>
</dependency>
<dependency>
    <groupId>com.lmax</groupId>
    <artifactId>disruptor</artifactId>
    <version>3.4.1</version>
</dependency>
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
    <exclusions>
        <exclusion>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-logging</artifactId>
        </exclusion>
    </exclusions>
    <version>2.1.2.RELEASE</version>
</dependency>		
```
log4j2-spring.xml
```log4g2-spring.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Configuration>
    <Appenders>
        <Console name="Console" target="SYSTEM_OUT">
            <PatternLayout pattern="%d [%traceId] %-5p %c{1}:%L - %m%n"/>
        </Console>
    </Appenders>
    <Loggers>
        <AsyncRoot level="INFO">
            <AppenderRef ref="Console"/>
        </AsyncRoot>
    </Loggers>
</Configuration>
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10150229/63663918-07030a00-c7f7-11e9-80d0-5593a81066be.png)
AsyncLoggerConfig Interceptor run normal but TraceIdConverter Interceptor may not well

> AsyncLoggerConfig Interceptor run normal but TraceIdConverter Interceptor may not well

I found the reason. You may forget to add dependency
```xml
   <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.skywalking</groupId>
      <artifactId>apm-toolkit-log4j-2.x</artifactId>
      <version>{project.release.version}</version>
   </dependency>
```
whichi is a basic demand to print tid
If apm-toolkit-log4j-2.x is fogot, traceId can't be transfered and corresponding intercept point doesn't work.
What is your question? What is agent main?
But if I have a local skywalking server, I have data.
i want hot loading agent. Java SE6 began to provide a way to add agents dynamically after an application's VM was started, known as agentmain

In 6.3, there is a TTL bug, which have been fixed in master branch.  Take a look at this doc, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/ttl.md#elasticsearch-6-storage-ttl.
Use minuteMetricsDataTTL, hourMetricsDataTTL and dayMetricsDataTTL to replace otherMetricsDataTTL. And Record TTL is not working, it uses dayMetricsDataTTL.
Ref #3283 #3292
@ascrutae Please take a look.
No, we are not using that. If you have interests, read the document about the differences. We need to change class structure, so agentmain is not the option.
ok，3Q

@wu-sheng Yes, exactly, it's jvm-timezone's story~

@lmzhizhe Bug had been fixed. 

Change the data type of PXX index column named **detail_group** from keyword to text by using elastic api:  [updating-field-mappings](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.3/indices-put-mapping.html#updating-field-mappings).
@lmzhizhe The index template also need to change the data type. [Template API](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.3/indices-templates.html)
Internal communication protocol has been changed, you need to change backend to 6.3 at one time.
Do you upgrade from old version?
I find is Time zone problem
I find is Time zone problem,think you

@wu-sheng This PR is ready for review now, all the review comments are addressed, thanks for your review :) , and @JaredTan95 please feel free to comment and review if you are interested in this
NoSuchMethod should be processed by witness class, rather than try-catch. You should create another interceptor and instrumentation for the case.
Please submit a new pull request by following that path. Appreciated.

@wu-sheng It took me some time to test the case, the final test passed. Through the communication with wu-sheng, some problems are confirmed and solved. Thanks for your support. skywalking-ui trace span info as follows:

> Is `org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.light4j.define` the right package name? Look like light4j has higher version(2.x), those plugins should have different package names.

@wu-sheng I saw that some plugins like postgresql-8.x and dubbo-2.7.x did not include versions in their package names so I thought it was ok, but I can change the package name. Before doing so, let me check if the plugin code can work with Light4j 2.x as you requested in https://github.com/networknt/light-4j/issues/167#issuecomment-524703434. It might make more sense to remove the 1.6.x instead.

We are using it as an unique seq creator. Not for metadata storage. Distributed lock is bad for performance.
Same here. No special shut down.

> We are using it as an unique seq creator. Not for metadata storage. Distributed lock is bad for performance.

Whether the es consistency feature can be satisfied。
Zk or redis to implement distributed lock instead
No plan to do this, yet. Zk is low performance too.
You could do anything you want. We haven't plan to do that. Adding another component is not good for end user. It is not that necessary.
